summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence between U.S. Attorney's Office personnel regarding the approval of a travel memo for a trip to Sweden related to the Epstein case. The emails discuss scheduling a meeting and obtaining final DOJ approval for the travel.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York
persons.context: The sender of one of the emails, discussing the travel approval form and offering to meet.

events.title: Travel Memo Drop-off and Approval Request
events.description: A travel memo for a trip to Sweden related to the Epstein case was dropped off for approval, following a delay in obtaining OIA approval.
personsInvolved: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York

keyFacts: A travel memo for a trip to Sweden related to the Epstein case required final DOJ approval.
The approval process was delayed due to a need for OIA (Office of International Affairs) approval, which was received on the morning of January 31, 2020.
The correspondence indicates ongoing legal work and international coordination in the Epstein case in early 2020.
The email participants' names are redacted, with only the generic title 'Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York' visible.
